BiblioData.Title: Magnetoresistive device
BiblioData.Abstract: A magnetoresistive device comprises a ferromagnetic region (5), a non-ferromagnetic region (6), an insulating region (7) and a conductive region (8). The insulating region is arranged between the ferromagnetic region and the conductive region so as to provide a tunnel barrier. The non-ferromagnetic region separates the insulating region and the ferromagnetic region.

Claims.P: 1. A magnetoresistive device comprising an insulating region arranged between a ferromagnetic region and a conductive region so as to provide a tunnel barrier and further comprising a non-ferromagnetic region which separates the insulating region and the ferromagnetic region.
2. A device according to claim 1, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region is configured such that the ferromagnetic region induces a magnetic moment in the non-ferromagnetic region.
3. A device according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region comprises a metallic non-ferromagnetic material.
4. A device according to claim 3, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region comprises a transition metal or an alloy including a transition metal.
5. A device according to claim 4, wherein the transition metal or alloy comprises platinum.
6. A device according to claim 4 or 5, wherein the transition metal or alloy comprises palladium.
7. A device according to claim 4, 5 or 6, wherein the transition metal or alloy comprises iridium.
8. A device according to claim 1, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region is antiferromagnetic.
9. A device according to claim 8, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region comprises a single layer.
10. A device according to claim 8 or 9, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region comprises an antiferromagnetic material.
11. A device according to claim 8, 9 or 10, wherein the antiferromagnetic material comprises a rare earth element or an alloy including a rare earth element.
12. A device according to claim 11, wherein the antiferromagnetic material includes antiferromagnetic dysprosium.
13. A device according to claim 11 or 12, wherein the antiferromagnetic material includes antiferromagnetic erbium.

15. A device according to claims 8 to 14, wherein the antiferromagnetic material comprises a transition metal or an alloy including a transition metal.
16. A device according to claim 15, wherein the antiferromagnetic material includes platinum.
17. A device according to claim 15 or 16, wherein the antiferromagnetic material includes manganese.
18. A device according to claims 8 to 17, wherein the antiferromagnetic material comprises an antiferromagnetic oxide.
19. A device according to claims 18, wherein the antiferromagnetic material includes [alpha]-iron(III)oxide (Fe2O3).
20. A device according to any one of claims 9 to 19, wherein the layer has a thickness of one, two or three monolayers.
20. A device according to any one of claims 9 to 19, wherein the layer has a thickness of more than three monolayers.
22. A device according to claim 8, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region comprises at least two layers.
23. A device according to claim 22, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region comprises first and second layers.

24. A device according to claim 23, wherein the first layer comprises a first transition metal or an alloy including the first transition metal and the second layer comprises second, different transition metal or an alloy including the second transition metal.
25. A device according to claims 24, wherein the first layer comprises chromium.
26. A device according to claims 23 or 24, wherein the first layer comprises a ferromagnetic material and is configured such that the material behaves antiferromagnetically.
27. A device according to claim 26, wherein the first layer comprises manganese, iron and/or cobalt.
28. A device according to any one of claims 23 to 27, wherein the second layer comprises tungsten, palladium, platinum and/or iridium.
29. A device according to any one of claims 23 to 28, wherein the first layer has a thickness of one, two or three monolayers.

33. A device according to claim 32, wherein the metallic ferromagnetic material comprises cobalt, nickel or iron or an alloy comprising cobalt, nickel and/or iron.
34. A device according to any preceding claim, wherein the ferromagnetic region comprises at least two ferromagnetic regions separated by a non-ferromagnetic region.
35. A device according to claim 34, wherein the non-ferromagnetic region comprises a metallic non-ferromagnetic material.
36. A device according to claim 35, wherein the metallic non-ferromagnetic material comprises platinum.
37. A device according to any preceding claim, wherein the insulating region comprises an oxide.
38. A device according to claim 37, wherein the insulating region comprises aluminium oxide.
39. A device according to claim 37, wherein the insulating region comprises magnesium oxide.
40. A device according to any preceding claim, wherein the insulating region has a thickness separating the conductive region and the non-ferromagnetic region of at least about 2 nm.

42. A device according to any one of claims 1 to 41, wherein the conductive region comprises a non-ferromagnetic material.
43. A device according to claim 42, wherein the conductive region comprises a transition metal or an alloy including a transition metal.
44. A device according to claim 43, wherein the conductive region comprises platinum.
45. A device according to any one of claims 1 to 41, wherein the conductive region comprises a ferromagnetic material.
46. A device according to any preceding claim, arranged as a multilayer stack including the ferromagnetic region, the non-ferromagnetic region, the insulating region and the conductive region.

54. A method of operating a magnetoresistive device according to any one of claims 1 to 50, the method comprising:

55. A method of fabricating a magnetoresistive device, the method including:
forming a ferromagnetic region ;
forming a non-ferromagnetic region adjacent to the ferromagnetic region;
forming an insulating layer adjacent to the non-ferromagnetic region; and

58. A method according to claim 55, 56 or 57, comprising:
applying stress while depositing layers.
